definition: School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])

sentences.english: In this experience, I no longer proud, learn.
sentences.chinese: 在這次經歷後，我不再驕傲，虛心學習。

sentences.english: Under the influence of the school of mind, he was both successful and unsuccessful.
sentences.chinese: 在陽明心學思想影響下，他有得有失。

sentences.english: The subject of this thesis focuses on characteristics of Mencius's theory of heart.
sentences.chinese: 本文之主題，則集中於孟子之心學特質部份作探討。

sentences.english: Yang-ming's Theory is literati's supporting point with which they doubt and criticize the reality.
sentences.chinese: 陽明心學爲文人作家懷疑和批判現實提供了精神支點。

sentences.english: Her teachers always told her to learn new words by heart.
sentences.chinese: 她的老師總是告訴她要用心學新單詞。

sentences.english: Chapter One illustrates the origin of the mind theory that produces Li's thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 第一章論述李贄求真思想所產生的心學淵源。

sentences.english: "Intuitive knowledge" is an important category of Yangming's psychology.
sentences.chinese: “良知”是陽明心學的重要範疇。

sentences.english: The next morning at school, the teacher asked Peter if he had learned the three words by heart.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，老師問彼得是否用心學那三個詞了。

sentences.english: She's a family girl at heart and a student of gymnastics and dance.
sentences.chinese: 她內心裏是乖女孩在一家女子體操中心學舞蹈。

sentences.english: In structure, it is a multi-dimensional system which are constituted by the law of logic.
sentences.chinese: 結構上，心學是暗守邏輯一致的多維繫統。

sentences.english: "Nothing exists beyond the mind" is an important idea in Wang Yangming's mental outlook system.
sentences.chinese: “心外無物”是王陽明心學體系的重要命題。

sentences.english: It is from this belief, he would put forward a new theory of Mind.
sentences.chinese: 正是從這種認識出發，他才提出新心學的理論。

sentences.english: Wang's theory spread till now; have a significant impact at home and abroad.
sentences.chinese: 王門心學流傳至今，在海內外擁有重大的影響。

sentences.english: Thus, to learn the secret of successful transformation into Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 因而，虛心學習和企業改革成了日本人樂成的法門。

sentences.english: From then on, he learned humbly and dared not ask to go home.
sentences.chinese: 從此，他虛心學習，再也不敢要求回家了。

sentences.english: His wisdom reflected in the heart-mind theory also enriched the cultural treasure of the Yi learning.
sentences.chinese: 他的心學智慧也反過來豐富了《易》學的文化寶藏。

definition: restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
Second Sage, traditional title of Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] in Confucian studies
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
